beginner.name: Breathing Meditation
steps: Find a quiet and comfortable place to sit
Close your eyes and take a deep breath
Focus on your breath as it goes in and out
If your mind wanders, gently bring it back to your breath
Continue for 5 minutes

beginner.name: Body Scan Meditation
steps: Lie down in a comfortable position
Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths
Start from your toes and move up to your head
Notice any tension and try to release it
Take your time with each body part

intermediate.name: Loving-Kindness Meditation
steps: Sit comfortably and close your eyes
Take a few deep breaths to center yourself
Start by sending love to yourself
Then extend it to loved ones
Finally, extend it to all beings

intermediate.name: Mindful Walking
steps: Find a quiet place to walk
Walk slowly and deliberately
Focus on the sensation of your feet touching the ground
Notice your surroundings without judgment
If your mind wanders, bring it back to walking

cognitive_techniques.name: Thought Challenging
steps: Identify the negative thought
Question its validity
Look for evidence against it
Consider alternative perspectives
Replace with a more balanced thought

cognitive_techniques.name: Worry Time
steps: Set aside 15 minutes each day for worrying
Write down your worries during this time
Outside of worry time, postpone worries
Use this time to problem-solve
End with a relaxation exercise

cognitive_techniques.name: Mindful Observation
steps: Choose an object to observe
Notice its color, shape, and texture
Observe without judgment
Focus on the present moment
Practice this for 5 minutes

journal_prompts: What emotions am I feeling right now?
How can I respond to these emotions?
What would help me feel better?
What am I grateful for today?
